tags: martin luther king vs. Malcolm x

vocabulary.definition: transfer or delegate (power) to a lower level, especially from a central government to local or regional administration.
vocabulary.example: The company decided to devolve decision-making authority to individual departments.

vocabulary.definition: official public announcements, especially those dealing with a matter of great importance.
vocabulary.example: The president made several proclamations regarding environmental conservation.

vocabulary.definition: turned to (a course of action) as a means of achieving something, especially in a difficult situation.
vocabulary.example: The team resorted to using unconventional tactics to win the game.

vocabulary.definition: express (an idea or feeling) fluently and coherently.
vocabulary.example: She was able to articulate her thoughts on the topic with great clarity.

vocabulary.definition: form an opinion or conclusion about.
vocabulary.example: He should not be judged solely on his past mistakes.

vocabulary.definition: entrust (a task or responsibility) to another person, typically one who is less senior than oneself.
vocabulary.example: The manager delegated the project to his most experienced team member.
